intro: Calystegia fraterniflora, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous vine characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Calystegia fraterniflora is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread aggressively through its extensive root system.
